markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Breastplate](/Armor.aspx?ID=10)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 8 gp

**AC Bonus** +4

**Dex Cap** +1

**Check Penalty** -2

**Speed Penalty** -5 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 16

**Bulk** 2

**Category** Medium

**Group** Plate
</row>

</column>

---

Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of [plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=13) or [half-plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=12) armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-4" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Armor</title>
[Breastplate of Command](/Equipment.aspx?ID=148), [Breastplate of the Mountain](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2137), [Numerian Steel Breastplate](/Equipment.aspx?ID=811), [Prismatic Plate](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1383), [Rebounding Breastplate](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1070)
name: Breastplate
